segments.text: Hi , Mary , can I have a minute ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , actually I want to tell you that I've put in notice .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Many reasons . I've been here for too long . Next year will be my five-year anniversary . I want a change of setting . Besides , our company is downsizing . I don't want to stay on just to be let go .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But they wouldn't lay you off ! You are the most experienced project manager in the company .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Maybe . But that's not kept the new boss from breathing down my neck . To be honest , I've got a better offer from another company .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh that's great , congratulations ! What's your new position ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Senior director of market research . In addition to a nice pay rise it has some nice perks , like a company car , one month paid vacation , and an apartment downtown . And it's an international company so I'll have lots of chances to travel and meet new people . I'm really looking forward to it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sounds a great opportunity . I bet that made the decision to leave a lot easier .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Indeed . But let's stay in touch . I'll let you know how things go .
segments.speaker: S1
